website_summaries.verdict: A good budget alternative to buy when you want a simple extension hose for quick waste management.
pros: More flexible and usable than other budget options
End fittings provide a good seal using the swivel-bayonet design
Easy to roll up and store when not in use
cons: Not as durable as other budget and premium extension hoses

customer_reviews.title: Poor design or quality control.
customer_reviews.text: THE PRODUCT I received has major flaws. there is only 2 lines of threading on each level so this will not anchor well into the rv sewer inlet and worse still, when the thing is screwed into the sewer inlet then the rotating flange hits the ground and you cannot hook it up. The elbow needs to be taller to make this work. Fortunately I have another older male fitting to the rv sewer ground inlet and will glue them together to make this work. Either poor design or poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Oh What Fun
customer_reviews.text: How can you just love a sewer hose? Well, to be honest I only really like it a lot. Best hose I have ever had. I like the length that is achieved by connecting them together. I back my motorhome up my driveway and connect the hoes to the sewer trap I installed. The clear fitting that connects to the sewer gives a wonderful show of things going down the drain. Takes some of the boredom out of the work. Also lets you know when things are truly clean. Guess I am easily entertained. The included hose caps seal the empty hose "emissions" during storage which is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: J Doherty

customer_reviews.title: Absolute JUNK after only 1 month, each one leaks bad
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these as I was going to travel for 2 months and never wanted to end up short and always have a back up. It's been 1 month and every single one has failed now. They break where wire is. I almost always been in shady places and stored away from heat sources. I'm also a picky person about not just throwing things around, but put away neatly and nicely so things will last. But not these, oh no, these things are almost magic and it's been so much fun to be surprised at dump station. Especially with black tank being dumped first. Aaaaggggghhhhhhh.
customer_reviews.author: All American Mall

customer_reviews.title: Leaking from all twist connections on first use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this hose to replace existing hose that came with the RV. I just installed it and dumped gray tank and it was leaking from under the twist connector in both locations, the main hookup and the extender connector. At first I thought I did something wrong and did not connect it properly. But I double checked and it was leaking between the connector and the hose. How bad can my luck be that a brand new sewer hose is leaking. You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I needed an extension to use in very rare cases when I couldn’t get close enough to the dump station, so I opted for this cheap one. To my surprise, the hose material and the fittings look to be only slightly less heavy duty than my RhinoFlex hose. And unlike the RhinoFlex, this hose reverts back to its original short length after use, which helps it store compactly. I had learned with all sewer hoses never to extend it more to than 80% of the advertised length if you want the hose to last very long. This hose is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: David GarthTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Wants to contract
customer_reviews.text: No leaks. Tight fittings. Easy to connect. Did not like the hose. It wants to spring back to being short. You need a person pulling hose and holding onto place if no threaded fitting is available. The hose does not ratchet out like my old one and stay stretched out. It wants to contract.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Easily tears
customer_reviews.text: I was highly disappointed with this hose. It has flimsy plastic that easily tears/splits. I remember taking it out of the package and examining it. There were no defects. So I went ahead and installed in the rear bumper of my TT. As I pulled it out to hook it up at our campsite, I noticed small incision like tears on on it. Luckily, I didn't leave my other sewer hose at the house. I would not recommend this item at all. Always bring a spare.
customer_reviews.author: StrykEagle

customer_reviews.title: springs leaks
customer_reviews.text: This is not a very reliable product. I sent this back when i got it. It is identical to ones I already own. These spring leaks pretty easily. Once that poopy water gets out, your site gets pretty stinky. Get the Camco hose that is darker brown in color. It's more robust, and has the unique feature of staying compressed or stretched open. Another issue with the hose I'm rating, is that it won't stay stretched when in use. It wants to pull back together and can pop out of the sewer input. More poopy water to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Jake The Indy Top Dog

customer_reviews.title: Very nice hose kit.
customer_reviews.text: I am familiar with the more rigid hoses, while this is more floppy for lack of a better word, but it seems it might be more durable (has a feel like that) than the other type hoses I have used before. It also came with caps for each end when storing the hoses. Only thing I would prefer is if the "clear" visual window in the elbow was more clear. It is more a frosted white, so you can still tell when stuff is flowing, but I prefer the clear window of Rhino that shows no doubt what is flowing (TP, etc).
customer_reviews.author: Ann Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Hose Split in less than 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hose 4 months ago and it has already split. I am ordering a replacement hose from a competitor. I live in an RV park and haven't traveled since buying the hose - so this hose has not failed from multiple connect/disconnect actions. A product like this should not fail so quickly. Unhappy Camper.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Accomplished What We Wanted.
customer_reviews.text: We bought a new travel trailer that has two separate gray water tanks; one drains with the black water tank in the typica way but one has it's own outlet. We bought this Wye fitting so we wouldn't have to swap the sewer hose around to drain all three wastewater tanks. It does exactly what we wanted it too. We bought an additional section of sewer hose so we can keep all the tanks connected to the sewer until it's time to empty them and then leave them in place.
customer_reviews.author: F. G. Fidura

customer_reviews.title: exact replacement
customer_reviews.text: The dog chewed the end of the old hose and this was a perfect replacement for it. They are difficult to get on since the reinforcement wire makes a 3 inch tube but the plastic tubing is smaller. You'll need something to push against like a counter etc and work it on slowly. I used a popsicle stick to help push it in place once the tubing was on the neck but any blunt object will work. Works and fits perfectly with the other Camco attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I cant wait until the rest break....
customer_reviews.text: These things are garbage. Stick with the old tried and true accordion style. I've bought 6 of these because my connection is a good distance away(full time rv liver here). I am now down to 3. The sheathing tears with just the slightest movement. DON'T put it in a rocky area and drag because a pebble will rip these thing wide open. The best thing about these hoses is the connections. At least Camco did that right. They also never return back to their original length if/once stretched out. Making for a p.i.t.a. to store. As the headline says... I CAN'T WAIT UNTIL THE REST OF MY HOSES BREAK!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon H

customer_reviews.title: Poor connection to sewer hose.
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I’m really disappointed in this product. The part that screws into the ground works well enough. But hooking it to my sewerhose did not work well at all. It leaked. No matter how many ways I tried to connect. It leaked. It’s going in the trash unless someone can tell me how to tighten it more. It was connected to a valterra connector. Update. Figured out the problem. Somehow I was missing a gasket. Found a replacement one at camp world and is good now.
customer_reviews.author: Munoz

customer_reviews.title: It works well
customer_reviews.text: This sewer hose works well. It carries crap from the RV to the sewer. It is supposed to stretch to 20 feet, but I think that is a stretch (no pun intended). While I have not measured, I am guessing it will stretch 16-18 feet. Any more than that, and I would start to worry about the connections breaking, or the hose itself ripping. I do like that it comes with caps you can put on the hoses when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Serves it's purpose, kind of.
customer_reviews.text: The first one I bought lasted 8 years of occasional use. So that means taking it out of the rear bumper storage and shoving it back in each trip we took. I was happy with it, so got another one. Edit: took off a star because when I finally got around to putting it in the bumper of my camper, the yellow joints won't fit in!! Now, unfortunately, I will have to keep it in one of the side pockets during travel...gross...
customer_reviews.author: First a Mom

customer_reviews.title: 10 ft extension, just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have the Camco extreme 20 ft sewer hose system and found I needed some extra length. Especially at home when I want to use my home septic to dump. This was reasonably priced and hooked up to my existing system to give me just the length I needed when the dump station is in a weird location or, as stated, using my home septic.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Not close to 10'
customer_reviews.text: Although the connectors on each end were sturdy, the hose itself was a big disappointment. My wife and I had to pull hard to get it to stretch out to the point we thought the ends were going to come off and we could only get it to stretch out to 8'. Even at 8' we felt like it was putting stress on the hose and connector that goes on the end to the sewer hole at the campground. It was like pulling on a bungee cord. Felt like it would snap back. If you need 10' this is not the hose to buy. I am returning and looking for different hose that truly stretches to 10'.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Don't waiste your money, buy Rhino-Flex
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. Measured at 16 feet while not being under tension. I needed 19 feet, so I stretched it. Ripped in a bunch of places within 3 days. If it is being sold as a 20 foot hose, it needs to go to 20. Buy the Rhinoflex. It goes to 20 and stays there.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Matthew Eddins

customer_reviews.title: No leaks for us!!
customer_reviews.text: The only reason for knocking a star off of this is because with the caps on its really tough getting it in the bumper storage. But it's not much of an issue I've only used 1 section so far so I keep that with the rest of my "tools" in one compartment with the caps on and the other 10 footer is still unused and in the bumper clean. Purchased a clear elbow to keep an eye on my black tank and these work great with no leaks whatsoever for me. Not sure why people have had a hard time but for us these work great.
customer_reviews.author: Skred

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly durable
customer_reviews.text: First one lasted about 3 weeks until it started leaking. 2nd one noe onto freezing temps and it cracked and leak everywhere .
customer_reviews.author: Jordan kuti

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Hookup was easy and extra caps and accessories helpful. Unfortunately, the connection at the clear elbow leaks and allows smelly black water to spread around the ground. When the weight of the hose full of water hit this connector it pulled away from the coupler and we had a huge mess! We have passed the return date otherwise it would be going back.
customer_reviews.author: Solidcore

customer_reviews.title: Good quality & a good length.
customer_reviews.text: This product is great quality for the price. The length is good for an RV. I am disappointed that the part that attaches to my RV water tank is slightly too large so it doesn’t not seal tightly. But I do have an older RV (27 years old). Newer RVs should t have this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Adam McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Great extension!
customer_reviews.text: This extension works perfectly for my situation. My camper had a 10’ hose that wasn’t long enough to reach a sewer connection unless you were right next to it. The extension has the quick connection on both ends, so it is locked tight and gives me a full 20 feet.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Just what was ordered
customer_reviews.text: I use this for a drain hose on my washing machine. That way the water goes into my garden instead in my septic tank or wasted. I live way our in the country so this is perfect. I have two so I have a good length to move the water around with. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S Barnhart

customer_reviews.title: the fitting for the pipe needs to be a 45degree angle
customer_reviews.text: all the hoses and fittings look like quality products but I couldn't use them . if the dumping station would have been flush with the ground i'm sure it would have worked fine . the dumping station I was at was counter sunk about 10 inches below ground level and with a 90 degree bend on the elbow fitting that connects to the pipe i couldn't connect the drain hose . a 45 degree angle would have not been a issue
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Nice simple sewer hose. I live in my camper for the summer and this thing gets a lot of use. I do not have any problems with leaking pipes or connections like other users. Arrived exactly as seen in the picture and stretched out easily to the length I needed. I was looking at the more expensive models but this works great, so why spend the extra money on a dirty water hose?!
customer_reviews.author: LawStudent88

customer_reviews.title: work fantastic
customer_reviews.text: The swivel sewer hose work fantastic. Emptying your black water is never a nice job but with the swivel hose it make it much easier because the hose does not twist and cause the end to pop out of the sewer hole. Having the 20 feet is great when I hook up to a site with sewer available because I have more than enough hose to reach any sewer hole. The bayonet fitting keeps the end that goes in the sewer in place and I do not have to fear it going loose when I empty the black tank. The hose is heavy duty and you can feel when you pick it up it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Sandie

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this item in july, 2017 but did ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in july,2017 but did not try to use it until december of 2017. The product description said it was to have storage caps supplied. No storage caps came with this item. The female end of this hose is supposed to have an O-Ring installed to seal it for proper use. No O-Ring was supplied. Very dissapointed in this product as it is not usable as delivered.
customer_reviews.author: Romel42QRH

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: First use and BOTH hoses have cracks or pinholes in the ridges and now I have crap water everywhere around my camper. Nice job campco! If I was returning back to you directly I would include some crap water. Don’t buy. Go rhino everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Iseedumbpeople

customer_reviews.title: falls apart easily
customer_reviews.text: Good concept, but falls apart easily, the side that attaches to the sewer pipe is not connected well to the side that has the wye connections, it pops back together easy enough, but ended up with a mess or sewage to get cleaned up and definitely is not worth the hassle or money. Connection to my hoses was a bit tight, but I don't know if that's the fault of this product, my sewer hoses, or both. There are many other brands that make this type of product in one piece so it can't come apart as this one does, spend the extra $2 and get one that won't cause you the stinky cleanup
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for occasional use
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as the Rhino line, but this hose is good for the odd times when you need an extra few feet....but you are not going to get 10 feet out of it as it is so tight you only get about 5 feet. I tried stretching it out, but that didn't work. Either way, I highly recommend for the occasional needs and filling the gaps, etc. Oh, and the swivel works pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Already had one of these systems and love it. I bought this second one to make ...
customer_reviews.text: Already had one of these systems and love it. I bought this second one to make sure I have enough tube to get to the drop at the campground. I haven't encountered anything longer than the 20' span myself but have seen some sites at the places I have visited with drops further than even 30'. I take care of mine very well and make sure to rinse and dry after every use before storing it.
customer_reviews.author: rottentaco

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: This was a waste of money! Bad product. Poorly constructed. Had major leaks right out of the box. Would have returned but the whole poo water thing. Leaked poo water all over the place! Luckily it was in the grass. Do yourself a favor and get the sewer solution.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to store in bumper.
customer_reviews.text: Finally used this hose yesterday and wow so much better than my old hose! I love the 2 sections of hose. I dump at my home and do not need a long hose. I love how I can store it in my rig just in case I am on the road and need the extra length. Sections are easy to attach and the hookup to my rig is really easy to take on and off. This easily stores in my bumper unlike my old one. So happy with my purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Sue Puffer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty Hose
customer_reviews.text: This set up is nice, Went to my rv and set it up along with camco clear elbow and it is perfect for what I needed. heavy duty and worth every penny. well update in a few months and see hoe it holds up. I Recommend this as a better product. UPDATE! Have been using it for awhile now and noticed that the end that goes into sewer is not staying connected, It pops out of its socket when water is flowing through it. This should have a better connection with a locking mechanism. Still all in all it works ok and will figure out how to keep it down on sewer.
customer_reviews.author: DJSOUNDS

customer_reviews.title: Quality hose
customer_reviews.text: Order was shipped quickly during COVID-19 pandemic and it does exactly what it's supposed to do. It locks in perfectly with my existing hose and the connectors are easy to use and seem to be made of a durable plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Leathers Bangor, Maine

customer_reviews.title: Quality at Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of using cheap hoses that developed pinhole leaks on the 3rd or 4th use and leaky hose-clamp fittings on the end. Especially when dealing with RV sewage. Spend a couple more bucks to get a better, more durable hose and pre-attached fittings and avoid the gross mess created by drips. I should have bought these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Update
customer_reviews.text: Does what it should. Added benefit the two ends lock together to prevent any unwanted "spillage". After just three uses this last weekend I picked up the hose to empty and it tore right at one of the seems. Poor quality lasted 3 months and 3 uses and was stored inside when not in use
customer_reviews.author: David Peters

customer_reviews.title: Good server hoses for my RV.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this item again but only because it tore from dragging on the floor. They need to be replaced at least once or twice a year anyways since they are sewer hoses. Will continue to buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Hellogabbiest

customer_reviews.title: Make sure the size is correct for your needs
customer_reviews.text: The material it’s made out of is perfect. Very durable. Unfortunately it isn’t the right size for my trailer but it doesn’t take away from the convenient way it connects for great storage
customer_reviews.author: Toy Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Works as should
customer_reviews.text: Works in the cold so far. Only complaint is I would like if the too piece would 'lock' in place rather than twist as it can easily be untwisted to unlock. Other than that it works great
customer_reviews.author: albert henderson

customer_reviews.title: Cracked hose after a few uses.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed, hose cracked between wire ribs after two uses. Didn’t have freezing conditions or any physical damage to hose. Fortunately the crack is near a coupling, so will cut and replace coupling. Won’t buy this grade hose again
customer_reviews.author: Willy

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I'm Not So Rough with My Poo Pipe
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure about the other reviewers who say this thing is flimsy. I have had no problems with it. I mean... don't stab it with knives and drive over it and you'll be just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it
customer_reviews.text: I had so many issues with the stock hose that came with our camper(s), it was time to find something else. I've kept our stock hoses, but they stay in the rear bumper. Since I bought this, easy attaching and connections that don't leak, they don't get the bumper treatment. I have had no issues with leaking. It's nice to have 2 different lengths. And everything connects to itself. I'm very happy with it. Definitely worth it compared to more expensive hoses.
customer_reviews.author: mike r

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should
customer_reviews.text: Always use an elbow when duming my tanks. This clicks into place on my dump hose with just a twist. It fits several sizes of receiver pipes, or the rubber doughnut. It's sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: RwS

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed don't buy this hose
customer_reviews.text: i received yesterday and when i inspected i found a hole, the rest of the hose looks very cheap material, the only good thing are the fittings.
customer_reviews.author: Rall

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I have not set up at a campsite yet, but will this Friday evening 6/21/19. Did a run through at home and with the 2 hoses centered, the absolute best that I can get is 7 ft, so now I will have to get extensions incase I can't get within 7ft centered.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Beard

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a breeze
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hook up, no issues. This was exactly what we needed and no drama. Would recommend buying the hose stands with these to elevate the hose off the ground and create somewhat of an incline. Cheers and happy pooping!
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Tough
customer_reviews.text: very rugged but a little harder to store in a box, as the circle diameter are larger, if in you store in a straight bumper, not an issue as it collapses straight well.
customer_reviews.author: Martha A. Hurd Call

customer_reviews.title: excelent drain hose
customer_reviews.text: the fittings on this hose work very well, far better than hoses I have had before. Haven't had it long enough to determine the durability but it looks and feels strong.
customer_reviews.author: malcolm t morris

customer_reviews.title: Great product for price
customer_reviews.text: Found product to be fairly easy to install, haven’t used as yet but feel confident that it will do the job. As for longevity, you will have to ask me in a year from know.
customer_reviews.author: GrandpaSmurf

customer_reviews.title: Great for RVing
customer_reviews.text: Works like it should. We store it in the back RV bumper. Yes I see what people mean about the length and stretching it out to the full-size will probably make it rip... So don't do that! Lol Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: nmzkaufman

customer_reviews.title: Aweful don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: These hoses are garbage! Hooked up and one instantly sprang a leak. Went to adjust the hoses and the other split in half. Sewage everywhere. Don't Buy This Product!
customer_reviews.author: Jon Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Low quality hoses
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, cheap, cheap. Poor quality houses. Returned immediately for a refund. I'll stick with the rhino series.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie K

customer_reviews.title: Very weak, not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: After 2 weeks of use the hose started to come apart in several places, look like I tore it to pieces with a weed eater!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bunch

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with two holes in the hose
customer_reviews.text: Just used this for the first time and there are two holes in the hose in between the ridges. unfortunately it was the one I connected to the black tank! Will avoid camco products in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Taliaferro

customer_reviews.title: Leaks onirst use....2 diff itemsi
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 2 of these. One from Walmart and one from Amazon. BOTH leaked the first time of use. I was very careful and it still happened. I have 5 year old blue ones that have been abused and they don't leak. On these, the connections are nice but the hose is VERY VERY fragile, in fact, I don't know how I could have been more careful. Camco usually has good stuff but not this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of these in June. They are stored in a storage tube under the trailer. One of them has been used been for approximately 10 dumps and the other maybe twice when I needed more length. Both hoses developed tears in the vinyl in the last 2 days. Pretty much junk...
customer_reviews.author: Janie Ostlund

customer_reviews.title: But I bought the cheapest one so I new it would be like that.
customer_reviews.text: Have not tried it yet but one of the fittings is on really hokey it has tape on the fitting then the hose slides over it and I am either going to have to fix it or take my chances. It is really hard to move the hose and it is not held on with any hose clamps. I cant beleive it passed QC but it is not worth the trouble to send it back. Also the hose is a little thin. But I bought the cheapest one so I new it would be like that.
customer_reviews.author: Shin Y.

customer_reviews.title: this is a good product
customer_reviews.text: Did not have a scent that I smelled. Fits snuggly in the tube holder (could be a hair smaller in dia.) I am happy with the procduct!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cracked in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I just went out to empty the black tank, opened the valve, and immediately had black water spraying up from 3 different cracks in the hose. Had only be in place for 60 days. Very poor material! Stay away!
customer_reviews.author: Ross F. Crum

customer_reviews.title: Give me those old time connectors
customer_reviews.text: I like the old style add your own connectors. the old style if you get a leak you could cut it off and still use the hose, not with these. I've had mine for 2 years any find it hard to make it reach 20 feet so I have to carry 2 sets just to make sure that I'm cover for all events. I'll be going back to the old time connectors.
customer_reviews.author: CA

customer_reviews.title: Leaked
customer_reviews.text: End connector that attaches to camper did not fit tight and leaked badly. I threw out the box and cant return it, sucks for me. Buy a better quality hose.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey O'Mara

customer_reviews.title: Good Versitily and Quality
customer_reviews.text: Durable hose compared to others. Lots of options. Like the ability to block off either end of the hose after use with additional caps they provide. Make storage nicer. Good value for your $$. Bought this as an extension for my primary hose but like this one better.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Body

customer_reviews.title: One of the fitting is missing its o ring seal and will leak.
customer_reviews.text: looks nice and everything is good except one of the hose fittings is missing its oring seal and will not seal and will leak. Amazon does not seem to have a way to obtain the missing piece except return the whole thing. how stupid is that? Update! I emailed Camco and they are sending a replacement oring N/C. So I give Camco 5 stars. Amazon gets lower. The whole 20' fit in my new 19' airstream storage tube. I was told it would not. I did need to trim the ears with some big dikes.
customer_reviews.author: Kingsnake

customer_reviews.title: Crappy product haha!
customer_reviews.text: Had a bad deal with the first 5 dumps. The tabs that hold the hose to the fitting were already getting worn. Soooo poooh was dripping from pipe. I replaced the seal, that worked for 1 dump. Then I replaced the end piece with another camco end... oh man it alctally separated during the dump!! Glad the bulk of the poph was already down the drain but still shouldn't have happened..
customer_reviews.author: Jason  B. Cade

customer_reviews.title: Lacking a pump, it's the one you want in style
customer_reviews.text: It's a poo hose. Poo hose with a window to see if you need to continue to wait or not. Get the backflush kit. Don't do a pyramid.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Lamm

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t even bother!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my camper. The first one came cracket which they then replaced. The second came in looking great, went to go use it and try cracked and we had to go find another one to use for the weekend. Not impressed!!!!
customer_reviews.author: LeeAnn

customer_reviews.title: Torn in the box when recieved it
customer_reviews.text: hose was torn when took it out of the box, had to return it, and wait for refund until they received it back! Live and learn, bought it because it was cheaper. you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: John p

customer_reviews.title: The new hoses coupled together fine but would not fit my original hose
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of the Camco extension hoses to connect to my original Camco hose giving me the length I need to reach my septic tank clean out. The new hoses coupled together fine but would not fit my original hose, turns out Camco uses different size fittings for their different hoses. I had to change the appropriate end of my old hose to be able to attach to the new hoses. I don't understand why Camco would not use compatible connectors for their own products. Besides the fit issue the hoses are constructed well and do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects and makes huge mess!
customer_reviews.text: The white section of the hard plastic junctions easily disconnect from the yellow connector, resulting in waste water all over you, the ground, etc. NOT fun to clean up. Very unhappy with the low quality of this piece.
customer_reviews.author: Troy K.

customer_reviews.title: Clear view
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived as advertised and fits perfectly. Clear enough to know when debris has flowed and is running clear.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Gillmore

customer_reviews.title: Great hose for a great price!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this to add to a few other hoses to give us the extension we needed to empty the RV tank in our home septic tank. I liked the fact that it extends out and compacts back in like an accordion. I wouldn't say it is the greatest quality, but it serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: EBP72

customer_reviews.title: ... section is very helpful but it would be even better if it were clear instead of translucent
customer_reviews.text: Translucent section is very helpful but it would be even better if it were clear instead of translucent. Step down connector fits everything I have encountered so far. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: STraveler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit for Use as Extension or Portable Dump Hose
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for use as an emergency extension & as the regular dump hose for my portable black/grey water carrier. The sizing also allows me to use this hose for dumping after camping in a camp ground without sewer facilities in a dump station or for use when jetting out the black water tank.
customer_reviews.author: J. French Rennier

customer_reviews.title: One set was great and the other set for some reason had cracks ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 sets of these. One set was great and the other set for some reason had cracks in the hoses, one crack per hose which dumped sewage on the ground which had to be cleaned up. I will have to reorder because I need them and have always used this type of hose before with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality.  Caps and seals included for each length of pipe.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit. Seals tight. Fittings are larger in overall diameter than others. Tight fit in bumper carrier. I resorted to a box in the rear storage compartment of the trailer instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awful hose, both sections developed holes within a couple ...
customer_reviews.text: Awful hose, both sections developed holes within a couple of months of use. If you are using the hose on more than just the two week summer trip, don't buy this one!
customer_reviews.author: John T. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Good add on extension or works well by itself.
customer_reviews.text: Used this initially when in campsites that have a difficult full Hook up configuration. I added it on to my primary hose. Now, it is my primary hose as the original wore out.
customer_reviews.author: TheGam

customer_reviews.title: will not hold up
customer_reviews.text: I would NOT buy this product again. had it less than 2 months & it already has tears in line. PLUS you can not get a refund after 1 month. that's about how long it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: M.C.

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set up for an RV and at a better price than local sources. It includes caps and fittings and two 10ft hoses, for 20 feet of hose total. The hose will compact and can be stored in your square bumper if it is set up for storage. We are very pleased with this purchase and are hopeful that we don't forget this one like we did our last one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. I used on my travel trailer connected for 2 nights 6 feet from the black tank to the sewer. Well when taking g down the trailer there was a 3 inch crack already in the hose!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jas

customer_reviews.title: Check it before you empty your black water tanks
customer_reviews.text: Fresh out of the box, and it set up very easy. Did not notice one of the hoses had a massive tear in it (mind you it was fresh out of the box) until I had a smelly mess. I have the grey colored hose kit by this company also and the quality seems much higher on those. I am really bummed on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Tim and Beth

customer_reviews.title: works well as it can hooking 2 dump valves up
customer_reviews.text: I like the product, the sight window is very good. the only thing preventing a 5 star is when emptying the tanks, it backs into the other hose. I have to lift both hoses and twist the swivel back and forth to get a completely empty hose.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not leave unattended around overly enthusiastic helpers...
customer_reviews.text: A friend of a friend decided to help out and deformed my hose a bit. It should be fine, and I'm really more annoyed with him than with the fact that the hose didn't put up with the abuse as well as I'd have liked. I could have paid twice as much and had the same result, so now I'm just relieved I went with the bargain hose for the time being...
customer_reviews.author: M. K. Tomasello

customer_reviews.title: nice replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Florida weather/sun kills stuff fast. Wont pay hi$$$ for stuff the dont last. This lasts as long as others..
customer_reviews.author: joe walsh

customer_reviews.title: Sewer hose
customer_reviews.text: Sewerbhosenror rv this one is nice when you need extra footage to reach an septic tank will buy again
customer_reviews.author: annie

customer_reviews.title: Love the Wye connector! No more changing hoses between tanks!!
customer_reviews.text: Should have bought this sooner. High quality, perfect length. I really like the see through portion of the set - can tell when the draining is really done..
customer_reviews.author: RUNTY 1

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a new travel trailer and the sewer hose that came with it was nothing short of a joke. I purchased this to replace that. I feel that the price was fantastic for this item and it is definitely an upgrade over what I have . I am a little concerned about the durability of this , but if I use it carefully I'm sure it will last a while . They only give it four stars because of my concern with the durability
customer_reviews.author: Mark Buck

customer_reviews.title: Hose works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Have used this hose an an extension to my existing hose when needed, and it worked perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Randall Poplin

customer_reviews.title: but the one i received had a wire from the ribs that wasn't tucked into the end cap properly and stabbed me pretty deep in the t
customer_reviews.text: as a hose i guess it serves its purpose in theory and for the price i guess it is sufficient, but the one i received had a wire from the ribs that wasn't tucked into the end cap properly and stabbed me pretty deep in the thumb. to add to that, the end of the 90 degree end that fits to the dump station side of the hose came apart and i had to glue it back together. the thing works and it was a good price but the quality control is definitely off at the plant.
customer_reviews.author: Kaley

customer_reviews.title: Works great. One word of advice - if you're going ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. One word of advice - if you're going to store it in the bumper, be sure you compress it down before putting the end caps on. They're not only water tight, but apparently air tight as well. Took me a couple of minutes to sort out why they wouldn't fit in the tube when I knew it was long enough :)
customer_reviews.author: Woodman42

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Just what I expected. Much needed upgrade from what I had. Came early. Only problem was the delivery guy put it in front of the door so it was hard to open the door to walk outside and retrieve the package
customer_reviews.author: Dazed and confused

customer_reviews.title: Hose broke the very first time I used it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a back up in case I needed it. I did, I replaced the old one, which had sprung leaks. The very first time I used it, it separated at the hookup!!
customer_reviews.author: Mendy

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Great, I like it. Especially the caps. You can collapse the hose, put on the caps and it stays collapsed. When it gets older it begins to leak a bit of air and doesn't stay collapsed as well but you have had time to easily put it away.
customer_reviews.author: York Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing product
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this item. Took oi6t of box at campsite went to strech it out and it was what seemed to be stick together. Could not expand it at all. Could not be used at all
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It's ok. You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The price was good but the quality seems to be commensurate with the cost. I bought 3 of these. On the second use one of the hoses cracked and started leaking. The other two feel like they will do the same soon. If you're on a budget this will get you by but probably not for long.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Springer

customer_reviews.title: No storage caps
customer_reviews.text: The description clearly states that it had 2 storage caps. None with mine, sent back. Who wants leaky sewer hose.
customer_reviews.author: P Good

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: The quality of these two hoses is great. These get small when stowing and stretch nicely when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Powell

product_meta.title: Camco 39623 Revolution 10' Sewer Hose Extension - Heavy Duty Design with Pre- Attached Swivel Lug and Bayonet Fittings, Easy to Use and Compresses for Simple Storage
product_meta.description: Style:10' Extension Hose| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe Camco 10' Revolution RV Swivel Sewer Hose Kit contains everything you need for a quick, reliable hook-up. Features pre-attached fittings that rotate 360 degrees. The kit includes a 10' heavy-duty vinyl sewer hose with pre-attached swivel lug and swivel bayonet fittings and 2 storage caps. Other features include translucent elbow and wire guards to protect your hands. Also, the removable 4-in-1 adapter allows you to store in 4” square bumpers. Each 10' section compresses to approximately 2' for easy storage.
feature_bullets: Includes a 10' heavy-duty vinyl RV sewer hose with pre-attached swivel lug and bayonet fittings
Extend the reach of your Revolution sewer hose kit
Hose compresses to approximately 2' for easy storage

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,310 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
